intro: Lipocarpha perspicua, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and cylindrical flower clusters. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender, grass-like stems with small, scale-like leaves, and its inflorescence consists of a spike of tiny, three-lobed flowers. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Lipocarpha perspicua is adapted to moist environments and is often found in regions with seasonal flooding.
